Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Corinthian Linear Style pottery concave pyxis lid; underside, including flange; on top (much worn): two rows of staggered dots between wide and narrow bands; band on edge of rim.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 88, no. A112)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.328) (phase 3)
